protein.general_function: Involved in sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor activity
protein.specific_function: This protein binds the cAMP response element (CRE) (consensus:5'-GTGACGT[AC][AG]-3'), a sequence present in many viral and cellular promoters. Represses transcription from promoters with ATF sites. It may repress transcription by stabilizing the binding of inhibitory cofactors at the promoter. Isoform 2 activates transcription presumably by sequestering inhibitory cofactors away from the promoters

go_class.description: sequence-specific dna binding transcription factor activity

reference.reference_text: Chen BP, Liang G, Whelan J, Hai T: ATF3 and ATF3 delta Zip. Transcriptional repression versus activation by alternatively spliced isoforms. J Biol Chem. 1994 Jun 3;269(22):15819-26.
